location: On a ship at sea: a tempestuous noise

lines.text: Enter a Master and a Boatswain

lines.speaker: master
lines.text: Boatswain!

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: Here, master: what cheer?

lines.speaker: master
lines.text: Good, speak to the mariners: fall to't, yarely, or we run ourselves aground: bestir, bestir.
Exit
Enter Mariners

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: Heigh, my hearts! cheerly, cheerly, my hearts! yare, yare! Take in the topsail. Tend to the master's whistle. Blow, till thou burst thy wind, if room enough!
Enter ALONSO, SEBASTIAN, ANTONIO, FERDINAND, GONZALO, and others

lines.speaker: alonso
lines.text: Good boatswain, have care. Where's the master? Play the men.

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: I pray now, keep below.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Where is the master, boatswain?

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: Do you not hear him? You mar our labour: keep your cabins: you do assist the storm.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Nay, good, be patient.

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: When the sea is. Hence! What cares these roarers for the name of king? To cabin: silence! trouble us not.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Good, yet remember whom thou hast aboard.

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: None that I more love than myself. You are a counsellor; if you can command these elements to silence, and work the peace of the present, we will not hand a rope more; use your authority: if you cannot, give thanks you have lived so long, and make yourself ready in your cabin for the mischance of the hour, if it so hap. Cheerly, good hearts! Out of our way, I say.
Exit

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: I have great comfort from this fellow: methinks he hath no drowning mark upon him; his complexion is perfect gallows. Stand fast, good Fate, to his hanging: make the rope of his destiny our cable, for our own doth little advantage. If he be not born to be hanged, our case is miserable.
Exeunt
Re-enter Boatswain

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: Down with the topmast! yare! lower, lower! Bring her to try with main-course. A plague upon this howling! they are louder than the weather or our office. Yet again! what do you here? Shall we give o'er and drown? Have you a mind to sink?
A cry within
Re-enter SEBASTIAN, ANTONIO, and GONZALO

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: A pox o' your throat, you bawling, blasphemous, incharitable dog!

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: Work you then.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Hang, cur! hang, you whoreson, insolent noisemaker! We are less afraid to be drowned than thou art.

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: I'll warrant him for drowning; though the ship were no stronger than a nutshell and as leaky as an unstanched wench.

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: Lay her a-hold, a-hold! set her two courses off to sea again; lay her off.
Enter Mariners wet

lines.speaker: mariners
lines.text: All lost! to prayers, to prayers! all lost!

lines.speaker: boatswain
lines.text: What, must our mouths be cold?

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: The king and prince at prayers! let's assist them, For our case is as theirs.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: I'm out of patience.

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: We are merely cheated of our lives by drunkards: This wide-chapp'd rascal--would thou mightst lie drowning The washing of ten tides!

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: He'll be hang'd yet, Though every drop of water swear against it And gape at widest to glut him. A confused noise within:   'Mercy on us!'--  'We split, we split!'--'Farewell, my wife and  children!'-- 'Farewell, brother!'--'We split, we split, we split!'

lines.speaker: antonio
lines.text: Let's all sink with the king.

lines.speaker: sebastian
lines.text: Let's take leave of him.
Exeunt ANTONIO and SEBASTIAN

lines.speaker: gonzalo
lines.text: Now would I give a thousand furlongs of sea for an acre of barren ground, long heath, brown furze, any thing. The wills above be done! but I would fain die a dry death.
Exeunt
